Vote - AcceptText - lin361: Zuckermann has ⳨ κοινῶς οὕ(τως) - is the version here correct? if so it should be attributed. In lins 371, 373, 374 and 377 I would use just the "δ" and not "δ´" (the delta is marked as standing for a "1/4" and does not need the tick unless it is really on the papyrus as a separate tick). Otherwise this looks fine to me. The corrections made by J.-L. Fournet are all there, as far as I can see. J.-L. Fournet should check this and add a vote before the file is finalized.

l. 25 α (παρὰ) ϛ 𐅵 ζυγ(ῷ) : ϛ is Vitelli's reading (Zuckerman has δ, which is wrong); l. 34 Ἰ̣σ̣[ακίου] → ᾿Ϊ̣σ̣[α]κ̣[ίου]
l. 35 in the apparatus: " J.-L. Fournet (autopsy) (via PN) : Κυριακ’ prev. ed. : Κυριακ’ papyrus" is unnecessary (Zuckerman marks all the abbraviations with ’)
l. 36 Ψιμανωβτ (with overline on β) → Ψιμανωβτ (the overline is missing); l. 40 ρπδ → ρπ δ´ ζ(υγῷ). Please use the circumflex on names ending in -ῶς.

div.p: The text presented here has been brought up to date on the basis of the study of the original and infrared pictures (for the Florence part). The basis of the text is Zuckerman's edition but we have introduced corrections and changes (sometimes returning to Vitelli's text). Only in cases where the new readings affect the content of the text, have we indicated the source. There are a number of cases where the placing of brackets has been changed, letters dotted or undotted and diacritical marks have been checked and reintroduced; these changes have not been signaled individually in the apparatus. So far the following pages have been brought up to date : pages I, II, III, V, VI, VII, VIII, X, XIII, XIV, XV, XVII and XVIII.
